question.text: When overtaking a horse and rider you should

explanation.text: Horses can become startled by the sound of a car engine or the rush of air caused by passing too closely. Keep well back and only pass when it is safe; leave them plenty of room. You may have to use the other side of the road to go past: if you do, first make sure there is no oncoming traffic.

answer.text: sound your horn as a warning
go past as quickly as possible
flash your headlights as a warning
